remarks: Define the (proper) class of all metrics.  (A metric space is the metric's base set paired with the metric; see ~ df-ms .  However, we will often also call the metric itself a "metric space".)  Equivalent to Definition 14-1.1 of [Gleason] p. 223.  The 4 properties in Gleason's definition are shown by ~ met0 , ~ metgt0 , ~ metsym , and ~ mettri . (Contributed by NM, 25-Aug-2006.)
